value.name: Why Council Speaker Corey Johnson wants to be the next city comptroller
value.description: After pulling back from a mayoral run, City Council Speaker Corey Johnson has made a late entry into the race for comptroller. “I think the comptroller’s office is probably the most important job that New Yorkers are not talking about as it relates to the city’s recovery and future,

value.name: Corey Johnson Missing From His Hell's Kitchen District, Some Say
value.description: "Where's Corey?" asked a local magazine, accusing the City Council speaker of neglecting the neighborhood. His office pushed back strongly.

value.name: Teachers union backs Corey Johnson for NYC comptroller
value.description: The teachers’ union endorsed Council Speaker Corey Johnson for city comptroller. United Federation of Teachers president Michael Mulgrew on Wednesday said, “In particular, our committees noted Corey Johnson’s longtime support of public education and his ability to make city government work on behalf of working families.

value.name: Family mourns as two years pass with no answers in Louisville murder
value.description: Friday marked two years since 27-year-old Corey Johnson was shot and killed in his home in the Portland neighborhood, near the intersection of North 18th and West Main streets.

value.name: Drink-Throwing Road Rage Incident Leads To Drug Charges In Brick
value.description: A second incident led to shoplifting charges after police discovered more than $750 in items taken from Home Depot, Brick police said.

value.name: Federal prosecutor, 34, struck in the eye by stray bullet outside Brooklyn restaurant
value.description: Federal prosecutor Mollie Bracewell, 34, was struck in the eye by a bullet. Benjamin Bustamante, a 31-year-old man was also shot in the foot in incident. The shooting occurred in a row between rival gangs.

value.name: New York City Council approves ending "qualified immunity" for police officers
value.description: Critics say the law protects officers and allows them to do their jobs. New York City Council speaker Corey Johnson joins CBSN's Lana Zak to discuss why the law needs to end.

value.name: NYC's Politicians Should Stand United Against Excluding Cops from the Gay Pride Parade
value.description: NEW YORK-If nothing changes and New York City’s Pride Parade insists upon barring uniformed police officers, members of the gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender community organizing the parade will send a clear message to their brothers and sisters who also happen to be cops: You aren’t welcome in our community if you have taken the oath to serve and protect New Yorkers.

value.name: MPD chief: No specific crime pattern to homicides increase

value.description: Adrienne Adams and Ruben Wills City Council Member Adrienne Adams, a first-term Democrat, is among the several candidates seeking to become the next Speaker of the City Council.
